markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Mountain Geomancy](/Rules.aspx?ID=1526)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 211 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Mountains reach to the skies above, breathtaking and impassable. They stand ever-vigilant and seemingly outside the passage of time until, over the course of eons, even they crumble. Mountains serve as barriers and thresholds: boundaries between nations and demarcations between lush windward and arid leeward. This role leads geomancers to associate mountains with wards and barriers.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
name: Mountain Geomancy
search_markdown:

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 211 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

</additional-info>
text: Mountain Geomancy Source Secrets of Magic pg. 211 1.1 Mountains reach to the skies above, breathtaking and impassable. They stand ever-vigilant and seemingly outside the passage of time until, over the course of eons, even they crumble. Mountains serve as barriers and thresholds: boundaries between nations and demarcations between lush windward and arid leeward. This role leads geomancers to associate mountains with wards and barriers.
